website_summaries.verdict: The pump dispenser is a winner for this fish oil product, making it much easier to add to dogs’ diet. Pollock’s milder smell is also a plus.
pros: Owners are overall pleased with how well dogs like the supplement and its effects on their joint health, fur and skin
The pollock oil has less of an odor than salmon oil
Pump application is easier than trying to give pills
cons: Some owners aren’t happy with the oil’s fishy smell, either from the dispenser or on their dogs’ breath
Some complaints that the pump mechanism leaks

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this...we quirt directly on her food. My vet told us that white fish oil (like pollock) is the best type to use for joint issues and is great for older dogs. The salmon oil is also beneficial but helps coat/skin more than joints. Just an interesting piece of info I thought I would pass along.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Rancid
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased Grizzly Salmon oil several times in the past. Then the price doubled (or more) and I looked for a replacement product. I often buy fish and chips made from pollack, so I expected Grizzly's pollack oil to have a mild odor of fresh fish and to have acceptable taste. To give the company the benefit of the doubt, the container I received was rancid. The odor was awful, completely unlike the salmon oil I had purchased in the past from the same company. My dog would not eat if I put this pollack oil on his kibble. I can't blame him, this oil stank. I had to discard the container. I can't recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: The Irish Patient

customer_reviews.title: I love this
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love adding this fish oil to my dog and cats food. My dog is allergic to salmon and herring so I figured wed try pollock. It made both the cats and dogs fur super soft! I love that's it's good for their joints too! As other comments have said the packaging leaks when opened- it does to an extent it is just poorly packaged, but the overall product is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tor

customer_reviews.title: Great Omega Product
customer_reviews.text: My dog, Ren readily accepts this Pollock oil when added over food. Ren has mild environmental allergies and I supplement her diet with a variety of Omega Fatty Acid products to keep her skin and coat healthy. I also use Grizzly krill oil, and while that has quite a different profile with amazing benefits it does seem messier. I will definitely keep using Grizzly Pollock oil as it is easy to dispense, readily accepted by all of my pets, does not have a strong odor and is very economical. This will be a permanent part of Ren's Omega supplement rotation for its proven benefits and variety to prevent boredom/refusal.
customer_reviews.author: LifeWithRenTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good oil, Great pump container
customer_reviews.text: The oil does have a bit of a fishy scent and it makes our dog's breath kinda stinky after he eats., but it does help his coat and prevents dandruff. Also, the pump container is fantastic! We've tried a few different brands and the container or pump always leaks and it's a huge stinking mess. This pump is very easy to control and doesn't leak, drip or make any sort of mess.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: It's good for her.
customer_reviews.text: We got a rescue dog with many behavoral/physical problems including a skin parasite and constant itching. (I don't mean just 'itching', I mean Chinese water torture consitently that would require the dear dog to put out of her misery!!!) Seriously, I lost weeks of sleep because of her pain!! I started her on the Grizzly pollack oil and things eased immensely. Our naturopath tested her and found the parasite she came to us with and we dealt with that as well...but the pollack oil has stayed in her diet for our 2 years having her and I am grateful!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Palla

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it, helps give them beautiful coats
customer_reviews.text: Edit: while we loved this product it is unlikely we will purchase again since it has almost doubled in cost. My St. Bernard needs extra motivation to eat. We have tried other sprinkles and sprays to flavor his food and nothing worked. I started shaking each meal in a pump of this and not only does he eat now, he has the softer coat ever. We started giving my lap/pyr mix some too and it has changed her dry coat to soft and silky. I am unsure of the pain relief qualities but it must taste good and definitely improves coat condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong antioxidant
customer_reviews.text: I cant say enough words about how life changing this product has been with my pets overal health, i see him way more active and his coat is shining like sunshine. Give it a shot it's 100% worth it and GREAT VALUE TOO! Great product Grizzly and more affordable than the salmon oil. Differences are literally Salmon should be more for coat and joints, this one operates at organs levels which for me makes it even better Ps: My dog is obsses with the flavor of this thing, i can definitely see how much he's enjoying his meal now.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Great product but it gives my dog gas!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7 year old mastiff that appeared to be having trouble getting up in the morning so we tried this product for her joints. She enjoys her Royal Canin food, but she really seems to love the fish oil that I put on it too. I feed her outside so the smell of the fish doesn't really seem too bad. Overall it seems to be working very well and she's running around and playing much more now. My one and only complaint is that she has become VERY gassy! I mean to the point I have to leave the room! HAHA! But so long as she's not in pain, I can handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Wanttie

customer_reviews.title: Great supplement to help with skin and coat
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted a pit bull from the local shelter, pitbulls are prone to itchy, dry skin and my new boy was no exception. He had lots of dandruff and was losing hair like crazy but after putting 5 pumps of this in his food for a week his skin and coat have vastly improved. His coat is much softer and has a healthy shine and his dandruff is all but cured. Plus, he loves the taste of the stuff, I put it in his food but I'm sure he would eat it straight! Definitely recommend this product if your dog has skin issues.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Doggy Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: Our 14 year old dog loves this on his food! We put two pumps on each meal, and it hasn’t caused any digestive issues. He has vomited in the past when given fish skin so I was worried about fish oil, but it agrees with him. It seems to be helping with his joint/arthritis issues. He’s been very perky and energetic, and on his second bottle. A tip for storage; we put it in the door of the fridge, so have avoided the complaints customers have stated about a smelly pantry. It doesn’t smell at all when kept cold.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: I believe this product is giving our lab an ear infection. My other dogs are just fine, which are a German Shepard and chihuahua. It does make their breathe very unpleasant and they were gassy for a week or so when starting. I haven't noticed a difference in the coats yet and that's why we bought it. I have noticed a difference in my vet bill do the labs infections and my vet said to stop giving it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnee

customer_reviews.title: Good fish oil supplement for a dog
customer_reviews.text: I used to give fish oil capsules to my dog: I had to break the shells and press all the oil out. Now with this, I just squirt it into my dogs food and I am done! The ingredients list look good and legit. The smell is different from the human fish oil supplement, so definitely do not try to use it yourself. I have not noticed any differences in hair, nails or other, but I am happy with the convenience it gives me.
customer_reviews.author: ProMann

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: This Pollock oil makes my picky eater dog want to scarf down his food. Although I haven't tried other kinds yet to compare the smell, this one is smelly once I've pumped it out, but oh well. The vet recommended giving the picky one fish oil of some kind (among other things) to help repair his torn ACL since we opted not to do surgery. The non-picky dog loves it too, and it seems to help his joints and movement (since he's old and a little hefty). So I think it's doing some good, even though I've only used it for a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Claire A

customer_reviews.title: SMELLS terribly! and doesn’t do the job for his coat and skin
customer_reviews.text: The smell is atrocious and it is not making my dogs coat shine, which means it probably isn’t really helping his coat. I have an English Cream Golden retriever and when I say the coat isn’t shiny...it’s not shiny... I’m going back to what I used to use, Baie Run Canine Omega3, which my vet said to use. Trying to save money is one thing but in this case for my boy...not!
customer_reviews.author: Stormee

customer_reviews.title: Best value by far
customer_reviews.text: We have an older doberman with a bad hip, and since we started using salmon oil on his food we have seen some of his activity and pain go away. The amount you get in this jug for the price is by far the best value. He also will get picky about his food sometimes, so adding a little extra encourages him to eat. This product has really improved his way of life.
customer_reviews.author: CHUCKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for my lab for about 1 year now. Not only his coat is much nicer, but I noticed that he stopped chewing his paws. Not sure if I can attribute this to the oil, but that is the only thing that changed in his diet, so it must be it. Either way, it is well worth the $. Plus it lasts forever, since for a big dog I use about 2 pumps daily.
customer_reviews.author: Aulona

customer_reviews.title: Shiny Coat
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for a while but I couldn’t really notice the difference because I was giving it to my dog whenever I had enough time to make it in the morning. Now that I’ve been home, I’ve been giving it to him daily. It’s been a month now and his coat looks shiny, it glistens in the sun and it feels softer. Can’t really judge it for pain relief since my dog doesn’t have any pain, he loves the taste and it doesn’t smell too fishy.
customer_reviews.author: MyView01

customer_reviews.title: Very stinky.
customer_reviews.text: Smelling salmon is quite different than smelling salmon oil. Salmon oil does not smell like fish. It’s quite unpleasant. And I selected this product for its packaging as well, because I have not seen a bottle of salmon oil that doesn’t leak. This bottle leaks worst of all. Very funny, asking me to rate it’s flavor, like I’m going to taste it.
customer_reviews.author: Jed Fish Gould

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t be without this
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying this for our Rottweiler since she was six months old I wouldn’t go without it we coat her food morning and night she almost will not eat food and less it has this on it actually. Her coat is super shiny skin is super healthy no dryness even in the winter we give it to her for overall health and wouldn’t be without it
customer_reviews.author: JLKOhioTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Goes bad fast
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a supplement for my dogs. But after a month it was already started to turn rancid and went bad. It's a good brand and I noticed a difference in their coat. But they were indifferent about taste and I ended up wasting money. So unless you have a TON off dogs, or don't mind putting this smelly stuff in your fridge, go with a smaller bottle.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using a pump of this product on both of my corgis dinners for about a year now and they love it! I really think it has improved their coats and love that it supports other health benefits! They always look forward to dinner time because they don’t get it on their breakfast! My breeder recommended it to me and I’m so happy she did!
customer_reviews.author: JustineMFitz

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: My one dog was skipping around the yard. I took him to doc and was advised there is damage in his hind leg. He told me my only options were surgery which isn’t 100% or to give hi. Fish oil which isn’t 100% either. I opted for the oil because I wasn’t wanting to put him through surgery. It’s been about 8 months now on this oil and he isn’t skipping anymore. I know he has to be on this forever but it’s way better than surgery.
customer_reviews.author: WenWen

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: Just wow, within a week I could feel a difference in both my dogs coats! And my very itchy and sensitive German Shepherd has stopped scratching. 80% of his hot spots from scratching have all healed up. My Golden retriever has very soft hair again. I will continue to purchase for these reason. I knocked off a star because just as other reviews stated the bottle leaks at the push down part. Doesn’t leak enough to cost money but enough to leave a greasy mess wherever it sits. I now keep the bottle in a 2 gallon ziplock bag.
customer_reviews.author: cycho

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: as advertised, quick delivery, good quality & price. My dog always scarfs up his food when this oil is added. We've been using it for about a year and his coat is glossy and skin not flaky due to normal seasonal changes. No smell detected on him whatsoever but this stuff stinks if you get it on your clothes!
customer_reviews.author: JOSHILL

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bang for your buck when it comes to giah oil for your pets. I use this for my cats, my one has bad skin issues and it clears it right up. They won't eat food with giah in it for some reason but they don't seem to mind this. Obviously, being fish oil it has a strong fishy smell, so avoid getting it on your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Didn't Like The Taste vs. Pills
customer_reviews.text: I put fish oil in both of my terriers breakfast every morning to support health skin and joints (they have issues in both of these areas). I grew tired of cutting fish oil pills and squeezing them out into their morning feed, and thought this would satisfy the requirement. Unfortunately, the dogs did not take to it and I'm back to cutting pills with a scissor and spraying myself so I smell like fish all day.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: It's not expensive to take good care of your pet.
customer_reviews.text: This is some highly underrated stuff. My dogs coat feels like I doused him in fabric softener and his skin is in great shape. Not to mention the fact that he now eats without hesitation and had some constipation issues before this. If you're just feeding mans best friend typical dog chow and can't afford any higher end food, get a bottle of this and just put a pump or two in whatever Ol Roy corn kernels you have. One bottle lasts me months. Fido's digestion and coat will thank you!
customer_reviews.author: BaconPancakes

customer_reviews.title: Works great for dry skin!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves this stuff! I put a few pumps on his dinner every night. It immediately (within a day or two) got rid of the white flakes he had on his back from dry skin. He has black fur so it was very noticeable before. We also live in Minnesota so it’s coldddd outside and the heat is basically on all winter.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Dogs love it. I've been told by others that I shouldn't buy it in such a big volume.. it can go rancid. Hasn't happened yet, but I do keep it in the refrigerator. Dogs haven't been on it long enough to know if it's helping, but I take the human fish oil and it does wonders for my joint pain.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Working Well
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for my German Shepherds for about two weeks now and I have seen a big improvement in their coat and skin. My male has a bit of hip discomfort and I noticed him able to run around more easily with this oil. I use three pumps at breakfast and three at dinner over their dry food. They really seem to enjoy the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole S

customer_reviews.title: Great for my dogs and cat
customer_reviews.text: My dog that sheds buckets is no longer a walking 'pigpen'. My dog who had very ba dandruff and was really stinky is no longer either. And my cat who always looked matted even after brushing no longer does. Great product. As to smell, it's fish oil. As to taste, they don't seem to mind.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic excluding the packaging
customer_reviews.text: My dog needed something to help regulate his stomach bacteria and this worked wonders alongside a healthy dog food! My only complaint is the awful fishy smell (sometimes makes my dog's coat smell) and the cheap packaging. The pump often leaks and makes my hands smelly like the oil.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: It's definitely fish oil
customer_reviews.text: It did what it was supposed to. My dogs didn't seem to detest it, nor were they overly enthusiastic about it. It was fish oil. I use it as a mix in with their food to keep their coats nice and shiny. I am confused on Amazon's rating system. Flavor? Scent? Softness? The only thing I can comment on was the scent. Smells like fishes.
customer_reviews.author: rokonrae

customer_reviews.title: Love the product
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this product and We are running low so just came on to order some more. I was pretty shocked to see that the same 64oz container I bought for $28 is now priced at $42. Guess I will be looking for another option. Update: I still purchase the product and contacted the company. Pricing depends on the salmon season according to them and also fluctuates through third party costs. Overall my dogs love this stuff and my dad even uses it for his dogs. Their coats are extra soft and shiny now days.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Yummy
customer_reviews.text: “ I love the way it taste put on top of my doggy food. I don’t even notice the smell I am just so excited to eat. My hips hurt sometimes because I am a rather large dog who is very active but I haven’t been limping as much since starting this regiment added to my glucosamine two times a day. “ Trooper
customer_reviews.author: missy c

customer_reviews.title: Made both my dogs very ill with diarrhea and vomitting ...
customer_reviews.text: Made both my dogs very ill with diarrhea and vomitting within 24 hours of trying product. I stopped product immediately but my older dog was so sick that after a couple days had to bring her to Vet. $500 of blood tests & medications later the Vet confirmed that it was from this product and no other cause. I called company and just got a "sorry return the product to Amazon" which is really disappointing considering how much $$ I had to shell out to get my dog's gut back into order. Also, neither of my dogs are allergic to fish - they've been allergy tested and both consume fish on a regular basis. So beware!!
customer_reviews.author: SteveS

customer_reviews.title: Shedding Control
customer_reviews.text: My golden retriever is only one so he has never had any joint issues. However, he had been excessively shedding, itching, and had dandruff. Oatmeal baths and brushing weren’t doing the trick. My dog hasn’t even been using this supplement a week, and his coat is much sleeker, his isn’t itching nearly as much, and I have seen a very noticeable difference in his amounts of shedding. I am very pleased with this product and will continue to be a customer!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile dog supplement
customer_reviews.text: I used this for two different dogs for a couple of different purposes. Fish oil is a great natural anti-inflammatory. It is also good for easing the pain in dogs that have a joint condition such as arthritis or dysplasia. Would definitively purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: VA944S

customer_reviews.title: No more flaky skin! Suuuuper shiny coat.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using for 2 years now... I have a black cane coral and he has such a beautiful coat but over his rear area ( where he loves to be scratched!!) he would always develop this dry flaky white skin that just looked like dandruff and not consistent with his shiny coat .. is had a couple pumps to his food ( once a day) and wallah! This stuff works beautifully and he L O V E S it! A++ from my Mr. Bach!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Pups seem to like it, but the price doubled!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to come back to order another shipment to find that the price for the 64 oz went from $25 to almost $50! Pups seemed to like it and it may have brought a mild amount of relief to their old bones, but for double the price, I'll just look for a new product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Dog likes it.
customer_reviews.text: My dog was very skeptical at first but once she tasted her dry food with the Pollock oil dressing, she decided to wolf the whole dish down post haste. Fish odor is insignificant so far. Her itching seems better after a few days, so more to report in a few months time. Hoping for good results.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Miller

customer_reviews.title: Coat so soft
customer_reviews.text: My old GSD's coat is so smooth and soft since adding this into her meals. I feed raw primarily, but she's also been getting GF kibble every once in a while when money is an issue and this is the ONLY way she'd touch it at first. She refused any/all kibble offered, until I started squirting this on it, with some water to soften everything and to help keep her somewhat hydrated considering it's dried food. She eats it happily then. Her coat was really gross when I first got her in April, the raw food has helped but this just bumped it up a notch as far as softness goes :D
customer_reviews.author: B92

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this fish oil!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog used to be finicky about eating if she thought she might score something better, often by just hanging around or deciding not to eat her food. With one squirt of this on her less appealing dry dog food she licks the bowl clean every day.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: My 14 year old Terrier runs around like a puppy and my puppy has a soft silky ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. My dogs get a little squirt on their dry food once a day. My 14 year old Terrier runs around like a puppy and my puppy has a soft silky coat. My vet asked what I was feeding my puppy to make her coat so soft and pretty and when I told her it was fish oil she said it was great for their joints as well. I guess that explains why my geriatric Terrier is still so spy. I would recommend this for a beautiful healthy coat and pain free joints. The bottle is quite large and the pump make it so easy to use with no mess.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Fishy smelly but not bad. My dog grazes his food throughout the day, and the smell goes away so your house isn’t smelly lol. He’s super picky but he’s eaten the food with it , not sure because he likes or because he’s just hungry and that’s all there is lol. But if it’s good for him I’ll get buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: My dogs give it 2 paws up!
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended this for our 2 older dogs to help with itchy skin & overall health. I was skeptical that they'd eat it but the itching was driving them (and us) a little crazy. Amazingly, they LOVE it! They were "meh" eaters before so we'd add watered down wet food as a "gravy". We stopped that and just added the oil directly onto their kibble, stir it up, and they are eager to eat. I add a tiny amount of water to one bowl because my dog likes it softer but it doesn't diminish their enthusiasm. The itching has diminished as well. Not completely gone but nowhere near how it was. We are definitely believers.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Better dog for it
customer_reviews.text: I personally can not attest for the positive taste and smell. But my dog loves it and he has a better coat for doing so. Eventually this will be priced to high to be worth it, but for now I think the positives are bigger than the cost.
customer_reviews.author: PiNeeks

customer_reviews.title: Great price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using wild Alaskan salmon oil in my dogs with seasonal allergies & arthritis, but I decided to try this out due to the price. I've only been using it for a couple days, but my dachshund seems to be a little itchier than she was with the salmon oil. I guess it could be coincidental... Also I chose Grizzly products because of the ease of the pump dispenser, but I wish they would list the actual omega 3, EPA, DHA, etc doses in milligrams on the bottle, not just percentages.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kilgore

customer_reviews.title: Works great...hope you don't mind your kitchen smelling like fish when it leaks everywhere
customer_reviews.text: So, the product is great as far as I can tell. My dog doesn't care for it on his food, but if I put a pump in the bowl alone, he licks it up. I think his hair is actually softer after just a few weeks! However...the pump bottle leaks constantly, making my pantry smell like fish. Yuck. For this reason, I'm considering returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My dog was losing hair in patches and the vet said he had dermatitis. I started adding this to his meals. Within a week the shedding stopped and his skin and coat were soft and shiny. And he loves it and licks the bowl clean
customer_reviews.author: Jael

customer_reviews.title: Pollock not the same as the salmon oil.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cause my dog loved the salmon oil. I got the pollock oil cause I hear it’s better for joints. It does have a faint fish smell but it’s not the same as salmon oil and he seems not to like it. Wish I could exchange it at a retailer.
customer_reviews.author: Traildrifter2

customer_reviews.title: Dogs hated it
customer_reviews.text: I have used different kinds of oils in my dogs' food. They hated the taste and it had a super strong smell, and not the good kind. It took 2 hand washings to even get the stink off of my skin. It seemed to do nothing for the dogs otherwise. Waste of money. Buy the more expensive salmon oil and a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and although my dog doesn't love the salmon
customer_reviews.text: I read that this was really stinky, and when I got it, I realized why. It's smells awful. I tried to save some money by buying the pollack instead of the salmon. In the end, I purchased the salmon oil, which smells very strong as well, but not as strong as the pollack; and although my dog doesn't love the salmon, she is willing to eat it. I noticed the improvement in her coat after a few days, and she seems to be scratching less.
customer_reviews.author: Stress Relief Coach

customer_reviews.title: Great for our dog's fur coat!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog used to have very dry skin and her fur was getting patchy and coarse. Regular deep cleansing, although helpful, did not solve the problem. We started adding 2 squirts of Pollock oil to each of her two dry meals a day. Not only does our dog absolutely love the taste of the oil, but her fur got better within a few weeks. We now keep her fur short and clean, and with Pollock oil supplement, we definitely notice a positive difference. We considered the salmon oil as well, but the Pollock oil is much more affordable and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: ATX

customer_reviews.title: This product has worked very well for me it has ...
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked very well for me it has made my German shepherds skin and coat very soft and shiny. He had been having very itchy skin had several places chewed I am hopeful that this will help clear that as well. I will continue to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Good supplement
customer_reviews.text: I alternate this oil with the Grizzly salmon oil. These make a nice supplement that can help against allergies and dry, dull coats. This 16 oz bottle lasts me about a month and a half using once a day with three dogs (small, medium & large.) The fishy smell is mostly contained unless you get the bottom of the bottle and the pump isn't working as well. Then I usually put it into a container, where I can smell it more, but it's fish oil, so what do you expect it to smell like? Overall, a good product and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Charlemagne 🐇Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Bottle was leaking everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t actually used it yet so no idea on how it will help my pup. Came in a box with a sweater, for pup. Oil was leaking through a small pin hole in the top. Box was oily. Had to wash everything. Hole in bottle shouldn’t effect product so not going to return. Hopefully it will work well and I’ll come back and give you a better review!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Farts that could curdle milk.
customer_reviews.text: It's fish oil alright. It make my boys farts smell like the garbage that floats in the ocean mixed with death and plugged up sewer. It is helping his joints though so I guess we will just have to suffer.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs ate this for 3 days then went on a food strike. They refused to eat if we put the oil on their food. We've used a variety of salmon and fish oil with no problem, this was the first one they refused entirely. I have a huge bottle leftover and I'm hoping someone else can use it so I don't have to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Cari Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our GSD to be proactive and help with her joints, we followed all the feeding and storage guidelines but it still managed to spoil and grow mold at the bottom. My girl now has a serious aversion to things that smell like fish (I don't blame her).
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff right here!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Labs, and one of them is always scratching and biting at her legs. I purchased this fish oil and after only a few weeks I noticed a big difference in the scratching. Their fur is shiny and sheds less as well! I bought this size bottle and it lasted a month for 2 large Labradors. I cannot smell anything when I use it and the dogs will lick it right up even when it's not poured over their dry dog food. They love when I pull the bottle out of the fridge because they know they are in for a treat!!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this, my dog laps it up straight! I signed up for delivery every other month but I probably won't need that for one dog. Thankfully, my parents Golden loved this too so I will be giving them my extra bottles. Their other Golden who is spoiled (but still not fat thankfully) ate this on top of her kibble when they normally have to add canned to make her eat. Just based on the fact that their annoying picky eater loved this I would recommend it to others. I haven't had it long enough to see coat benefits yet but I'm sure I will see those soon.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Good product for older cats
customer_reviews.text: It is not odorless, in fact it is quite fishy smelling. It took a couple of days for the dogs to get use to it. Now, they won't eat their kibble unless it has the oil. One dog has a skin condition - rough, dry and itchy. After one month of use, the oil has seemed to help in that her hair is now shinier and her skin is not quite as rough. It has not solved her problem. The other dog's hair coat is sleek and shiny. Our 16 year old cat loves it. It has noticeably helped him. He is maintaining his weight better since he has been eating it.
customer_reviews.author: cup caker

customer_reviews.title: Poor Packaging/Mail Smells
customer_reviews.text: We (and our dog) like this product. This recent shipment. however, leaves much to be desired. First off, the packaging leaked which means the integrity of the bottle is compromised and secondly, since this was delivered with other items, those that rested underneath it wicked the leaked fish oil into those two other boxes in our shipment. The smell of this product is overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: Cally Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this
customer_reviews.text: My dogs won't eat their food unless we top it off with this oil. The price for the big jug is a great deal and it lasts forever! We started purchasing it from amazon because it's about 15 $ cheaper than our local dog food store.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Heid

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good product.
customer_reviews.text: Great value product. It really improved my German Shepherd's skin and coat. She has had skin issues her whole life, and is on pretty quality food. After giving this to her for almost a month, her coat is very shiny, almost no dander, it's helped her doggie stink, and she's shedding less. One big thing I've noticed is she doesn't scratch hardly at all; before she would dig big clots of fur out scratching. We're happy, she's happy and I wish I'd had her on this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly McGilly

customer_reviews.title: Stinky, Dog hated it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this instead of salmon oil thinking it would be a great less expensive alternative. My dog is not overly picky and usually will at least try anything but he wouldn't eat this even when I put it mixed in with his food and some table scraps he would normally wolf down (pun intended) I had to throw the whole thing out and wash his dish. It smells like rotten fish. I would but it for the price if my dog would eat it so I guess if your dog really will eat absolutely anything you can give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Pack

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: We have two dogs, 20-lb and 90-lb. We add this to their food every meal in specified amounts for their weight, and they both LOVE it. Their bowls have never been more clean and I think they would eat anything that we put this on. This is way better than giving them the fish oil pills since there is no extra gel capsule material, not to mention when they bite on a pill it sprays everywhere. I highly recommend this, it is super clean and easy to use with the pump. Keeps them healthy and loving their food.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: My dog dances for this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old Golden Retriever goes nuts for this stuff, she has always been a big fan of anything fish so I got this for her as a special something on her food. I was using canned wet food to make her kibble more appealing but thought this would have more added benefits. It is great for her Retriever skin,coat,joints and eyes. As soon as I pull the bottle out of the fridge, she dances around in a circle. I highly recommend it for a special treat and added supplement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An Essential item for Your Pet's Health
customer_reviews.text: This like most products of this type it's not a cure all for arthritus in a 13 year old dog. However it seems to offer sufficient relief to my pet to allow him to be mobile enough to enjoy life again, (at least in the warmer months). My only regret is buying this size container as it's more then I will ever use. If you have multiple pets however, its a good option. My dog tolerates it very well.
customer_reviews.author: jimsta1942

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been purchasing this for awhile now and my dogs love it! They won’t eat their food without it. I give them heart/flea meds but I’m sure this helps with that as well. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: N Gregory

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: My adopted dog had a history of demodex mange in her abuseful youth. Proper nutrition is most important. Quality food is number one, but this supplement also does wonders in keeping her skin & coat moist, soft and healthy with lots of Omega 3. My previous bottle did have a cracked pumper upon arrival, but this one was just fine. The product is so good (and she ikes it) that even on the broken one - I just poured the contents into another bottle. This is also good for joint health - particularly in big dogs. It does the brain some good as well.
customer_reviews.author: PAT

customer_reviews.title: The bottle has a very easy to use dispenser
customer_reviews.text: We have our dogs on this supplement for about two years, now. It gives them a very shiny coat. And they are very healthy and active. We have a 3 year one and an eight year old one. The eight year old one has problems with allergies and a sensitive stomach. This fish oil supplement really helps her with her allergy related dry skin. We just add this supplement to their food and they just eat it. The bottle has a very easy to use dispenser. Which makes it easy for us to dosage how much we want to give them. The price is very fair and it lasts us a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Kunstmann

customer_reviews.title: Fish oil
customer_reviews.text: Add this to my dogs food. Not sure if it really helps but I know fish oils have health benefits. Makes my dog fart a little more than normal lol. But she doesn't eat kibble, she is on a meat and veggie and healthy grain diet which gives her gas anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy A.

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. Been using it for over a year now on my Lab/Aussie mix. She has the longer coat which is 97% black. It is so shinny and soft. People always ask me how I make her coat shin like that. I turned my neighbor on to it with her Boston terriers. Her oldest had really dry skin and dull fur. Not anymore. She can't believe the change in him. They don't mind the flavor either. They get it with breakfast (mix dry and a little wet). No issues only positive reaction to the oil. Plus the cost isn't bad at all either.
customer_reviews.author: K. McLavy

customer_reviews.title: My dog is picky
customer_reviews.text: My little Chihuahua hates it. When I squirt it in his mouth he goes and rubs his face on his baby blanket trying to get it to go away. I'm sure it is a good product but my dog hates it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Omega Supplement
customer_reviews.text: I've been adding the Grizzly Pollock oil to my dog's raw food diet for a few years, and it seems to be working. I initially began by adding one pump a day. But as my pug has gotten older , I increased to one pump of oil twice a day (over food). I gave it four stars because I am not sure if it's "working," but knew that the pug needed some omega oils to supplement his raw food diet. I also add a powdered plant enzyme and probiotic. I believe this helps with skin and joints. I feed my dog raw meats that are formulated for dogs (Vital Essentials Turkey).
customer_reviews.author: indieblack

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Dogs with Dry Skin
customer_reviews.text: I first found Grizzly Pollock Oil at a local store, but found this 64oz packaging more economical and easier on the wallet. My dog has dry skin and feeding him two pumps of this oil on each of his meals has helped considerably! It took a few days for the oil to start working - he's eating it, it takes time for his body to digest it and its effects to kick in. It is also A LOT easier than trying to get those monster fish oil pills down his throat. Will keep buying Grizzly Pollock Oil and will keep buying from this seller, too.
customer_reviews.author: Shopoholic314

customer_reviews.title: Awesome results - long term value
customer_reviews.text: I have fed this to my 8 year old dog for about 7 years now. It started as a supplement for his itchy skin, but he has THRIVED! Still acts like a puppy and constantly getting compliments on how soft/shiny his coat is.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Craven

customer_reviews.title: Repeat shopper!
customer_reviews.text: Repeat order. I have four large dogs. I apply the appropriate amount to their food once a day as label suggests. Noted improvement in shine of coat. It appeared that it helped the Great Dane gain a little weight. I really like the pump dispenser. It makes this product so much easier to use. The smell does not seem to bother me. Though I am dispensing into food dishes and distributing immediately. I would also like to note that the flatulence a few of my dogs have dealt with from other fish oil is not noticeable since using the pollock oil. Very pleased customer.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie M

customer_reviews.title: GROSS
customer_reviews.text: My dogs, who will eat ANYTHING, refuse to eat their food if I put this on it. Not sure what it is made of, but I do not recommend in any way. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: H Tyler

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I noticed a difference in my dogs coat after about a week of use. the smell was not bad and the price is wonderful considering the price of other fish oils for pets. love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: My picky dog loves this and it's helped his coat
customer_reviews.text: He thinks he's getting a treat every time I add this to his food. He is one of the pickiest eaters ever but absolutely loves this stuff. I don't mind giving it to him because it doesn't smell as strong as other supplements we've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Stools

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and Puppies love it
customer_reviews.text: It dispenses well, no leaks, no clogs. It does not stink even though I leave the jug on my kitchen counter continually. The puppies love it so I assume that it tastes good.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: very convenient and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I recommend going with at most 32 oz size, since 64 oz is very big and the oil can go bad in the meanwhile. Other than that, it's a great fish oil for the doggy.
customer_reviews.author: Sia

customer_reviews.title: the bottle is a blessing and a curse
customer_reviews.text: It's great that you can just squirt it directly on the dogs food. But the pump seems to leak everywhere. The 2nd day we had it, the entire counter-top was covered in fish oi.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great oil, the pets prefer salmon.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, give to both the cats and the dog and it helps give them a nice shiny coat. I only give 4 stars because I also buy this brands salmon oil and it is a much bigger hit with the pets. Whenever I end up giving them this one instead they give me a look like I gave them the not good kind haha. I like to alternate to give them variety but they aren'​t the biggest fans compared to salmon which they adore, I have noticed this brand also has a krill oil, I will give that a try and see if the pets like it.
customer_reviews.author: CatherineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my picky husky to actually eat his food and it works. However with sensitive stomachs like his I have to alternate using it every other day because his stool is liquid if he has too much. I haven’t noticed a difference in his hair like others but I’m hoping it will get softer
customer_reviews.author: MoG

customer_reviews.title: works to support my older dog
customer_reviews.text: I have noticed his skin is less itchy and rough. His fur is softer and he is not scratching as much (at all actually) He is 15 so his age is a reality in his mobility, but I have seen him be more frisky. I have no medical gauge, just watching him and hoping. I am happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Andra Gutridge

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff so far
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good, I think. My dog lost all of his undercoat this spring (starting in Jan!), plus a lot of his top coat. It was very weird. And he had lot so of flaky dandruff. I got this in hopes it might help, and his undercoat has growing again and not as much dandruff. Could be a coincidence of timing and self healing, but I'm sure this is good for him either way. I really like the quality of the pump, too. It's tight, solid and pumps well with no extra dripping.
customer_reviews.author: FilmComposer

customer_reviews.title: Great oil for pups!
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced quantity of fish oil for large breeds such as my German Shepherds. Believe me, when you have 4, you must find things that work at prices you can afford. This does both.
customer_reviews.author: mholland

customer_reviews.title: Made All the Difference to My Dogs
customer_reviews.text: My cocker spaniel has skin issues, so I've been giving him Grizzly Pollock Oil for four years and his skin has been just fine. He did have one episode of skin sores recently, but that was because I changed his food. I went back to his old food, and the problem cleared up right away. I also give Grizzly Pollock Oil to my sheltie because her coat looked rough and dried out -- now it's sleek, shiny and gorgeous. This product comes with a pump, which makes putting it on my dogs' food twice a day very easy. As an added plus, both dogs like the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for our dogs
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love this oil on top of their dinner! I’ve gone through multiple bottles for our dogs and they look forward to eating their kibble each time.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Picky animals are picky no more
customer_reviews.text: Getting this for $20 was a great deal for me. I've tried salmon oil and I gotta say, pollock is way better. I am not sure what the difference really is but my dog eats his food more enthusiastically with pollack than he did with salmon and his fur is way better with pollack. This product is especially handy for picky pets, cats or dogs. If they are not eating their kibble or wet food or wet food/kibble mix, just drizzle it with this yummy pollack oil (smells pungent by the way) and watch them go in a frenzy. Vet recommended this to me for older dogs.
customer_reviews.author: GraceTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Subscribe and save!
customer_reviews.text: I have this on subscribe and save because it works fantastic for my dogs. I have a mini red healer, blue healer and a yellow lab. If my yellow lab doesn’t have it his hair will start to clump by his tail. Making it impossible to pet him without getting covered in hair. My healers look shiny and clean all the time even though they get a bath once a year. It’s a great product and lasts awhile
customer_reviews.author: Cicely Nichols

customer_reviews.title: yes!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to bribe my Great Dane puppy to eat his meals, as he is a super stubborn Butthead. We went through a phase of cottage cheese only, or he would only eat if he had two cups of cottage cheese, a very specific brand of cottage cheese, on his food. Tiring expensive and just general pain in the rear. I bribed him into eating his meal without cottage cheese with this grizzly Pollock oil, and it works like a charm. Not to mention his coat looks great and shedding is down. Our vet is also super happy that he is taking this.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBayer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't make much difference with shedding :(
customer_reviews.text: Two of the 3 dogs would eat it. One refused. After splitting the bottle between the two over the course of two months (one got two pumps on breakfast, the other got 3 pumps on breakfast daily), I didn't notice much a difference in their coats. I did not see a shinier coat, or a reduction in shedding. The dog who wouldn't eat it looked about the same as the other two. So far the only product I have seen a marked improvement of shed reduction, shine, and clearer eyes etc was Solid Gold Sea Meal with Olewo Karroten each once a day. I will just go back to that.
customer_reviews.author: ASRMama

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Our black lab has really bad dander during the colder months, so I did some research about how to remedy the issue. One thing I came across was adding fish oil to their diet. I am really glad I tried this because within a few weeks it pretty much cleared the dander up. There will always be some dander, but she was itching much less often and her coat is even more shiny and soft. I am really pleased with the results and I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it - need I say more?
customer_reviews.text: I will add that it is very convenient to use. We had been poking a hole it the bottom of a fish oil capsule and squeezing into the food then mixing. Now 3 squirts and a stir and we're done. And she likes the taste better.
customer_reviews.author: Twoapples

product_meta.title: Grizzly Pollock Oil Supplement for Dogs
product_meta.description: Size:64-OunceGrizzly Pollock Oil is rich in the Omega 3 and 6 fatty acids that are beneficial for skin and coat health, healthy joints, cardio health as well as for the nervous system and eyes. Sourced from sustainable Wild Alaskan Pollock with a high ratio of natural fish oils. Grizzly Pollock Oil delivers the right Omega 3 fatty acids, EPA and DHA, that are readily and easily accessible for your dog or cat's metabolism. Grizzly Pollock Oil is an excellent and sustainable natural source of fish oil rich in Omega 3 fatty acids. It is also used worldwide as the primary source for high quality white fish products.
